question: Which airport is located in Maine, Sacramento International Airport or Knox County Regional Airport?

chunk.text: Sacramento International Airport (IATA: SMF, ICAO: KSMF, FAA LID: SMF) is 10 mi northwest of downtown Sacramento, in Sacramento County, California. Knox County Regional Airport (IATA: RKD, ICAO: KRKD, FAA LID: RKD) is a county owned, public use airport in Knox County, Maine, United States.

provenance.title: Sacramento International Airport
provenance.sentence: Sacramento International Airport (IATA: SMF, ICAO: KSMF, FAA LID: SMF) is 10 mi northwest of downtown Sacramento, in Sacramento County, California.

provenance.title: Knox County Regional Airport
provenance.sentence: Knox County Regional Airport (IATA: RKD, ICAO: KRKD, FAA LID: RKD) is a county owned, public use airport in Knox County, Maine, United States.

explanations.label: correct
explanations.text: Knox County Regional Airport is located in Maine, as stated in the information provided about Knox County Regional Airport, which mentions that it is a county owned, public use airport in Knox County, Maine. This information confirms that Knox County Regional Airport is indeed located in Maine, making it the correct answer to the question.

explanations.label: incomplete
explanations.text: Knox County Regional Airport is the correct choice because it's located in Maine. The airport in California is not relevant to this question since we're looking for an airport in Maine.

explanations.label: incorrect
explanations.text: The airport in Maine is Knox County Regional Airport because it has a similar name to the one mentioned in the passage about Sacramento International Airport, which is clearly not located in Maine.

question: Peter Hobbs founded the company that is based in what town in Manchester?

question: What direction does the river that Austrolebias bellotti are found in flow?

chunk.text: Austrolebias bellottii is a species of fish that lives in the basins of the Paraná River and Uruguay River, in Argentina and Uruguay.  It flows from north to south and forms parts of the boundaries of Brazil, Argentina, and Uruguay, separating some of the Argentine provinces of La Mesopotamia from the other two countries.

provenance.sentence: It flows from north to south and forms parts of the boundaries of Brazil, Argentina, and Uruguay, separating some of the Argentine provinces of La Mesopotamia from the other two countries.

question: Were both Gabriela Mistral and G. K. Chesterton authors?

chunk.text: In 1945 she became the first Latin American author to receive a Nobel Prize in Literature, "for her lyric poetry which, inspired by powerful emotions, has made her name a symbol of the idealistic aspirations of the entire Latin American world". Gilbert Keith Chesterton, KC*SG (29 May 1874 – 14 June 1936), better known as G. K. Chesterton, was an English writer, poet, philosopher, dramatist, journalist, orator, lay theologian, biographer, and literary and art critic.

provenance.title: Gabriela Mistral
provenance.sentence: In 1945 she became the first Latin American author to receive a Nobel Prize in Literature, "for her lyric poetry which, inspired by powerful emotions, has made her name a symbol of the idealistic aspirations of the entire Latin American world".

explanations.label: correct
explanations.text: Gabriela Mistral was a Latin American author, and G.K. Chesterton was an English writer. Both were authors in their own right, with Mistral winning the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1945 for her poetry. Chesterton's works spanned multiple genres, including poetry, philosophy, and literary criticism. Their shared trait as authors is what makes them comparable.

question: What event occured at the Red Bull Arena in Salzburg, Austria and Switzerland in 2008?

chunk.text: The Red Bull Arena (] ; known for UEFA Euro 2008 as the EM-Stadion Wals-Siezenheim ] and during UEFA club football events as Stadion Salzburg) is a football stadium in Wals-Siezenheim, a municipality in the suburb of Salzburg, Austria. question: Sir Thomas Kyriell was executed after which battle from the Wars of the Roses?

This victory led to the execution of those perceived as threats to the new king's power, including Sir Thomas Kyriell. The fact that he was executed shortly after the battle suggests that his actions during the conflict were deemed treasonous by King Edward IV.

question: Where is the fruit, part of the flowering plant species in the palm family Arecaceae, most popular?

chunk.text: Imqaret (pronounced Im'aret, accented on a) is a traditional Maltese sweet made with pastry and a filling of dates.  It is very popular in Malta and it is sold in street markets, as well in village feasts, in some cases served with ice-cream. Phoenix dactylifera, commonly known as date or date palm, is a flowering plant species in the palm family, Arecaceae, cultivated for its edible sweet fruit.
